data.title: Richard Attenborough, colossus of the silver screen, dies aged 90
data.meta_description: Lord Attenborough, who was a mesmerising presence in British cinema for more than five decades, died yesterday at the age of 90.  The actor, producer and director was praised as one of the “true
data.text:
Lord Attenborough, who was a mesmerising presence in British cinema for more than five decades, died yesterday at the age of 90.

The actor, producer and director was praised as one of the “true greats of the silver screen” following his death at about midday.

Lord Attenborough, whose early role as Pinkie in Brighton Rock was said to be one of the best performances in film history, won multiple awards during his career, including Oscars for Gandhi, the film for which he will perhaps be most fondly remembered.

Tributes were paid from all quarters last night. David Cameron said: “His acting in Brighton Rock was brilliant, his directing of Gandhi was stunning — Richard Attenborough was one of the greats of cinema.”
